brief_summary.textblock:
A multicenter observational study trial validating Quality of Life assessment using EuraHS
      Quality of Life score and Carolinas Comfort scale™ in patients before and after laparoscopic
      unilateral inguinal hernia repair.

      Depending on the treating physician patients will receive a TAPP or TEP repair for their
      inguinal hernia and a self-gripping mesh will be used for the repair (Parietex Progrip
      Mesh).

      Primary endpoint will be assessment by the EuraHS-QoL at 1 year after laparoscopic repair of
      an unilateral inguinal hernia using the Anatomic ProGrip™ Laparoscopic self-fixating mesh.

      Secondary endpoints are assessment of the QoL 3 preoperative, 3 weeks and 1 year
      postoperative, recurrence rate at 12 months, intra-operative and post-operative
      complications, post-operative hospital stay, operation time and time to place the mesh, VAS
      (Visual Analog Scale) for pain at several control points, VRS (Verbal Rating Score) for pain
      at 3 weeks and 12 months, pain medication needed.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of Quality of Life Assessment After Laparoscopic TAPP and TEP Surgery of Inguinal Hernias Using EuraHS of Life Score and Carolinas Comfort Scale™

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Written informed consent from the patient or his/her legal representative

          -  Primary unilateral inguinal hernia undergoing a preperitoneal laparoscopic repair.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  No written informed consent

          -  Recurrent groin hernia

          -  Open hernia repair

          -  Bilateral hernias

          -  Concomitant repair of another abdominal hernia eg umbilical hernia

          -  Hernia repair combined with another surgical procedure

          -  Emergency operations, like incarcerated hernias

          -  Patients under the age of 18 years and over 80 years

          -  Pregnant women

          -  ASA score 4 or more

          -  Patients unable to perform the QoL assessment, because of language barrier or
             intellectual incapacity

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing laparoscopic unilateral inguinal hernia repair

clinical_study.official_title: Validation of Quality of Life Assessment After Laparoscopic TAPP and TEP Surgery of Inguinal Hernias Using EuraHS of Life Score and Carolinas Comfort Scale™

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: clinical evaluation, Carolina Comfort Scale™ questionnaire, EuraHS-QoL questionnaire, Visual Analogue Scale and Verbal Rating Score.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively (at inclusion), 3 weeks and 1 year, postoperatively recurrence rate at 12months

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
